abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the trade and transport
            facilitation project for Pakistan were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            borrower performance was satisfactory. Lessons learned from
            the project: formal project restructuring through
            streamlined procedures should be considered for projects
            that are well performing, but need to accommodate new
            realities (country or sector-wide). Introduction of trade
            facilitation measures requires commitment across a wide
            range of stakeholders in the public and private sector and
            cooperation to succeed. Better linking and sequencing
            technical assistance with investments could maximize
            implementation success and development effectiveness.
            Independent project management unit arrangements should be
            considered for projects requiring effective cooperation
            across related stakeholders.
